instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: i am not so familiar in macbook .. what to when a macbook a1708 no backlight?

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: i am not so familiar in macbook .. what to do when a macbook a1708 no backlight?

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What board do you have, 00840, or 00875?
Next time, post the model in the title, please.

Do you get image for sure on the internal screen?
Did you check external video?
Also check for USB activity.

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: 820-00875-01 this is the model number... i use flashlight on the screen i see image in the screen..

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: Do you get any voltage at PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT?

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: i dont have voltage in  PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT .. no short in  PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT ..

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: diode mode reading 1.0 red to ground then black probe to  PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT line

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message:
U8400 voltage check
ihave voltages on
VDDD PIN5 = 5V
VDDA PIN 18= 5V
EDP_BKLT_EN=0v (no short)
.....................................................
I have check voltage in f8400 it says 13.07v
what do next?

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message:
Really strange, EDP_BKLT_EN comes from PCH and you have image.
Try doing PRAM reset 2-3 times.
If no change, then try known good LCD assembly.

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: may I ask what is the voltage of EDP_BKLT_EN?

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: is this how to pram reset?.. option key +command+ P+ R?.. then 3x chime right?

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: i test the board without lcd

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message:
Do you mean EDP_BKLT_EN was 0V [B][U]without[/U][/B] LCD connected?
What did you expect in such case, if PCH didn't detect the LCD?

Always check voltage and signals video related [B][U]with[/U][/B] LCD connected.

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: sorry sir I'm not so familiar with MacBooks.. i try to test it with lcd tomorrow

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: I test now with lcd and do pram reset...    PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT =55v upon checking with lcd..

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message: i guess this issue is flexgate problem

threads.title: a1708 no backlight
threads.message:
This point to flexgate issue.
Backlight circuit works, but there is no connection with LEDs strip.
